messages.message: Another question is: where do we store these golden  ibocrs for long term safety? More generally how do we store all the loads of files and IP we have sitting on instabase.com (http://instabase.com)? We version our S3 currently, but I'd imagine there's a better solution there

Maybe we could start an official datasets.instabase.com (http://datasets.instabase.com) S3 bucket? There are lots of mint datasets we’d like to store somewhere officially too. 

Then we can mount it in. 

Also, we can use @Aaron Vontell ‘s data manager app to manage and browse the metadata around them: it was designed for exactly this situation!! :-)
Good to know OK. And how do we prevent ourselves from deleting the datasets in that bucket?
What if we added a RO mode to Instabase S3 mounts?
Wouldn’t stop us from deleting in S3, but we could enable versioning as ultimate backup and could be a nice feature for customers too
Eg an admin mounts one RO
Great idea. RO bucket sounds great that we can back up to
